attributes.action: Ban and prevent the sale of Microtransactions and DlC in games and apps.
attributes.background: Corporations within the gaming , mobile and software industry have become to big and greedy. Exploiting consumers for all of their money and making 100% profit from Microtransactions. Often making money off non existent things such as virtual currency. Also protecting people who have massive bills.
attributes.additional_details:
http://venturebeat.com/2014/02/21/report-finds-free-to-play-microtransactions-make-up-79-of-u-s-app-store-revenues/ 

http://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/phones/2013/02/kids-spent-3200-iphone-avoid-app-charge-hell 

http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2016-03-02-eas-ultimate-team-earning-around-usd650-million-a-year 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/microtransactions-are-ruining-video-games-2015-4

attributes.action: Make it tougher for foreign buyers to purchase UK properties
attributes.background: Places like Denmark, Singapore, Hong Kong, Switzerland & Australia have made it much tougher or more expensive for foreign buyers to snap up homes. However, UK still allows foreigners to buy and sell properties as they wish, making profits but pushing up prices which many UK families cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask that the needs of the British people be met first. A lot of foreign investment properties are empty when British workers are finding it harder and harder to even rent a place. 

Currently UK property developers like to pre-sell their developments to overseas buyers because, unlike UK buyers, they pay a deposit of 20% even before the project has started. It helps to finance their projects but makes Brits second priority.

attributes.action: Make prejudicial, unfactual and opinion/vote swaying news reporting criminal.
attributes.background: UK media is now completely corrupted & has become a weapon of mass destruction in itself. We urgently need revised legislation, to ensure that it is no longer used as a tool to sway public opinion in false or self destructive directions. We need this now for the good of the UK & more so for mankind.
attributes.additional_details: VOTE LEAVE TODAY was the front cover of the Daily Express, on the day of the EU referendum. A newspaper should report news for the benefit of the people. Not sway opinion for its own secret agendas. The first 24 hours after the killings in Nice, BBC and all news outlets kept stating Mohamed Bouhlel had no known terrorist links. Yet in the same breath, kept claiming it to be a war act & terrorist attack. If no links, this reporting is biased & inflammatory. Set laws now to stop the propaganda.

attributes.action: Reinstate the SKILLED MIGRANT VISA to allow commonwealth citizens to work here
attributes.background: For too long COMMONWEALTH citizens (AUS/NZ/CAN etc) have been denied the necessary VISA to come and work in the UK,  denying the UK access to their skills, knowledge and innovation. This is now more necessary than ever in a BREXIT world, and the UK needs to maximise the potential of this resource

attributes.action: Increase the number of Armed Police to deal with the growing security threat.
attributes.background: UK police forces are poorly equipped to deal with the current terrorist threat. A Nice, Orlando or Paris style attack in a UK city would see Police running for cover while they await the arrival of Armed Response units who could be tens of minutes away. Rural towns are especially vulnerable.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK is a highly likely target for an imminent terrorist attack. Our current threat level is "SEVERE" which means, "an attack is highly likely"

One person with an AK47 can fire 100s of rounds within just 1 minute.

The public & our Police Officers need protecting NOW rather than waiting for the next attack & reviewing how many lives could have been saved. More Armed Police would also act as a deterrent.

Armed officers should wear body cams to back up justification of any use of a firearm.

attributes.action: Raise the speed limit of the motorway to unlimited
attributes.background: In Germany I realized how efficient and well maintained the highways were and how advanced the "Autobahns" are similar to the "smart" motorways we have in the UK. I believe we should have a system in place where in certain areas of the motorway it should have an unrestricted speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: 6% of deaths occur on British motorways and 40% in urban roads. a further 54% of deaths occur on rural roads. compared with Germany their motorway deaths stand at 12%, 60% on rural roads and 28% in urban areas. I believe we should use the same system where we can adjust the speed limit to the road conditions using the smart motorways (such as limiting the motorway to 70mph in wet conditions etc) and introducing unlimited speed limits in quiet times such as 9pm-8am. This would allow less accidents down rural roads as there is a safer place to speed (as shown by statistics)

attributes.action: Force a review of Great Northern Rail  ( Govia) franchise
attributes.background: Great Northern Railways service has declined significantly since Govia won the franchise. The amount of cancellations is unacceptable on the service, delays and impact on paying customers getting to work and around London is severe.
attributes.additional_details: The cancellation logs for Great Northern should be made available for public viewing, the responses from their social media teams inadequate. Fares continue to rise with no improvement

attributes.action: Bar anyone who's used racist epithets/insulted foreign dignitaries from Cabinet.
attributes.background: A Minister of the Crown must be a fit and proper person, and Parliament should have the power to reject the appointment to Cabinet of someone who has used racist language or whose presence in government would impair Britain's diplomatic relations due to their having insulted foreign dignitaries.

attributes.action: Allow non resident UK Citizens to also vote on whether the UK Leaves the EU
attributes.background: British people living abroad were NOT allowed a vote and are hugely impacted by the outcome. We form a constituency of people who live a special way of life in the EU - the life that experiences free movement of labour and we well understand free trade benefits. An important voice could not vote.
attributes.additional_details:
I am British, I live in Germany. I have a UK pension, I am likely expected to pay inheritance tax upon death and who knows where I might retire. This decision affects people like me too and we need to have a vote on this matter.
The UK parliament should debate if we are now allowed also a vote which should be integrated retrospectively with the referendum already held, and see how this impacts the referendum result.

attributes.action: Referendums must be clearly won AND not disenfranchise relevant constituents.
attributes.background:
Issues important enough to create referendums should not be won by a simple majority, a clear mandate is required.
Voter Turnout >75% wins with >60%,
Voter Turnout <50% wins with >75% with a sliding scale in between.
AND British Ex-Pats should not be excluded on international issues.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is only meant to affect future referendums including but not exclusive to a 2nd EU referendum.
Many on both sides of the recent campaign called for the argument to be clearly won, before and after the vote.  Uncertainty, resentment and protest vote factors could be minimized by more definitive results.
Also, more than 2 million British Ex-pats were denied the vote despite life changing implications for them and the intentions of the Queen’s Speech of May 2015 Votes For Life Bill.

attributes.action: Make law all party members are allowed to vote in a party leadership election .
attributes.background: This law will make leadership races more democratic and stamp out gerrymandering.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number on contact.
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for companies to disclose their phone number when contacting people. This will give people the chance to call bar nuisance callers directly from home and hopefully bring a stop to the constantly ringing telephone and recorded messages.

attributes.action: Create a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather
attributes.background: We all know that the public holidays in the UK are unevenly distributed and usually coincide with periods of very poor weather. We can't blame the government for that, however, we do have the power to change it!
attributes.additional_details:
Instead of having two 'bank' holidays in May, we should designate an alternative one day 'Met Office' day every year. This would not be a day that the Met Office gets to chill out, but a day that is designated at short notice when the 'experts' at the Met Office are confident that we will all be able to light the BBQ and actually make the most of time with family and friends. 

In summary, exchange one of the May Bank Holidays for a moveable holiday to coincide with good weather.

attributes.action: Scrap the BBC and sell all assets for the NHS to save people £150 pa for life
attributes.background: The BBC has become an expensive white elephant with anything but a public service as its main goal. It is becoming extremely political and targeting minorities and politicians alike. It is time to make good use of its assets by selling it all and earmaking all proceeds to go to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
The use of subliminal images by the BBC in targeting minorities or immigrants or even Scotland is disgusting. It has political agendas far beyond its remit and even targets politicians. Even if you do not like Jeremy Cobyn, one day it could be any other politician which does not serve the ultimate controller of the BBC.

The NHS which is depleted and suffering could make better use of these resources for the welfare of the nation. And people would be less taxed too by its excesses of the BBC.

attributes.action: Tighten regulation on news media to prevent the manipulation of public opinion.
attributes.background: The recent referendum showed that some newspapers were heavily pushing their readership to vote a specific way, readers who only used those newspapers to make their decision may have voted without balanced arguments and hence may have been subject to manipulation of opinion by the newspaper itself.
attributes.additional_details: All news media organisations that publish in the public domain should hold a responsibility to provide a balanced view, rather than only printing facts or opinion that support the organisations own stance. The impartiality rules that govern the BBC’s political stance, should be considered for the rest of the news media organisations. The public needs to be provided with balanced facts and opinions to allow them to make their own decisions, rather than be steered by an organisations own view.

attributes.action: Change the law on combustion engine assisted push bicycles
attributes.background: In the UK it is the law to register, MOT, tax and insure a push bike with a combustion engine on. There are many kits available to fit to your push bike that range up to 80cc. In many countries they are exempt from registration and insurance with success and I think that the same should apply here.
attributes.additional_details: In countries such as Australia it is almost encouraged to use these vehicles as an alternative to cars. They are easy to use, build and repair, are very economical and cause less pollution than a single person travelling in a car. I believe that similar laws should be in place here to allow oppertunities for people who may not be able to afford or run a car or who wish to choose alternative transport. They will help to reduce city traffic and emissions and help to keep roads clearer.

attributes.action: Pull our troops out of any provocative acts towards Russia.
attributes.background: To anyone with a little knowledge it is easy to see that the US and UK governmentso are trying to provoke Russia with extremely dangerous and hostile acts, including the strategic placement of missile systems.  We the people DO NOT want a war with Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has sent troops to the Russian border.

attributes.action: Stop the bidding and banding system for new council/housing associations
attributes.background: This is for a better housing allocations as the bidding and banding system does not work for a lot of people and are left living in a place there not happy and doesn't meet the needs for the family
attributes.additional_details: I have been living i n a poky 2 bed ground floor flat for 5years and is not suitable for us as my child has hardly any space and bidding does not get us any where something seriously need to change please sign this petition to get a chance to get what we all need and deserve

attributes.action: Companies should have a tax contribution symbol indicating how much tax they pay
attributes.background: Companies should have a simple to understand visual indicator such as an emoji to tell consumers how much tax they contribute as compared to revenue and how much their ceo is paid in comparison to the income of workers and company revenue/growth.

attributes.action: Make MPs promise to protect certain EU legislation, including workers' rights.
attributes.background: I have never been a fan of the EU. As has been pointed out numerous times it is bureaucratic and its organisation has many flaws. That said I voted to remain because being a member has made the UK a better, fairer country. I fear this being undone and the country going backwards, not forwards.
attributes.additional_details:
17,410,742 people voted to leave the EU in the referendum, but 16,141,241 voted to stay. If slightly over 630,000 had voted differently the remain campaign would have won the vote. Though the wishes of the majority must be accepted, it would be intolerable to ignore the wishes of the remain voters.

If the UK wishes to be an outward looking nation then a public statement must be made by MPs from all parties that EU legislation regarding workers' rights and the environment will be protected.

attributes.action: To force councils to invest revenue from parking fines into parking facilities
attributes.background: It is a well known fact that parking fines generate huge profits for local councils, c.£600million+, but there is no action or interest in reducing the number of parking fines issued to motorists, as this is viewed as a profit generator for all local councils alike
attributes.additional_details:
Councils should be forced to invest the large majority of these funds into parking solutions/facilities i.e. underground car parks in densely populated cities and towns, or road improvements where parking improvements are not feasible.

Any improvements should reflect the requirement for resident, business and visitor parking.

attributes.action: For MPs to stop referring to each other as "honourable".
attributes.background: The EU referendum has shown that several MPs are quite happy to knowingly mislead the general public with untruths so the House Of Commons address of "my honourable friend" or "honourable lady/gentleman" is wholly inappropriate. Just referring to each other as "the MP for" would be correct.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance Payments applied to a Card that is regularly reviewed.
attributes.background: Child Maintenance Visa Cards would ensure that the hard earned cash is being spent on the child and not the mother. Accounts should be reviewed every quarter and receipts should need to be submitted monthly to confirm what had been spent. A app that lets you scan the receipts would keep things easy.
attributes.additional_details: Fathers who pay child maintenance for children should be allowed to see that their hard earned money is actually being spent on supporting the child, instead it is seen as a position of power and a way to undermine the father, the idea is to provide mothers with a card that can be monitored to ensure the money is being spent correctly, for example say there's £300 on the card and only £100 is spent that month the £200 left over should be put into a savings account for the child's 18th birthday?

attributes.action: Put an end to the driving theory process.
attributes.background: The driving theory test that is required in the UK is a complete nonsense. It wasn't deemed necessary in former years and it shouldn't be relevant now. Why should a memory test dictate whether you are suitable to drive? It is simply a money making scheme, which is highly unfair on young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Problems:
- Memory based.
- Favours those who prefer exams conditions.
- It keeps competent young drivers off the roads.
- It drains the money of millions of young people
- It wasn't deemed important years ago so why is it important now?

attributes.action: Allocate MPS seat in parliament according to their last name.
attributes.background: Placing those who represent us opposite each-other, in confrontation, creates a division that separates them and that they use as a fence, many times feeling comfortable attacking and shouting to each-other which would dramatically change if you allocate sitting in the house by alphabetical order.
attributes.additional_details:
Symbols, and orders have a strong impact in reality and in the way humans interact and relate to each other. A feasible way to start unifying this country is by simply making the members of parliament sit among members of the "opposition".  
That is how we, the people, that have given you this job, live and interact in society, and reflecting this in the house, would bring us a step closer to negotiate, to have compassion, to stop thinking of rivals and start thinking of building together.

attributes.action: Dissolve parliament.
attributes.background: Introduce compulsory voting and allow us the electorate to vote for and elect two individuals from each constituency
attributes.additional_details:
Adopt a 5 year parliament term, with an independently elected Prime Minster also on a 5 year term but elected out of sync at the 2.5 year mark so the PM serves across at least two parliaments and the MP's (possibly) serve two PM's during their terms in office.

HRH Prince William would be the ideal solution as the appointed Chief Executive of the country until the first new PM is installed. One day .

attributes.action: UK practical driving test time to be reduced.
attributes.background: 40 minutes for a driving test is a long time to sit in a car with an examiner looking at you throughout the test. Many people fail their test not because their bad drivers but because their nervous and sweaty.
attributes.additional_details:
Sitting in an exam is hard as it is, but sitting one in a car with an examiner next to guy watching at everything you do is another thing. I think the driving test time should be reduced to at least 20-30 minutes. 

Many people fail their test because their nervous and don't know what the examiner is writing, it puts the learner under a lot of stress and end up failing their tests. £62 is a lot of money to spend every time you fail and have to rebook a test. Reducing the time will be good.

attributes.action: Take down the government petition site.
attributes.background: Increasingly the government's petition site is being used for more & more frivolous purposes such votes of no confidence in individual ministers and efforts to reverse the result of the EU vote. These petitions are undemocratic in their nature and simply a means to complain having lost an election
attributes.additional_details:
EU Referendum petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/131215

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36634407

Examples of unnecessary "no confidence" petitions.

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/123469

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/111975

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/121152

attributes.action: Ban redoing referendums
attributes.background: We should not redo referendums

attributes.action: Vote under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act for a general election in 2018.
attributes.background: We will soon begin exit negotiations with the EU. It is essential that the British people be given a chance to vote on Brexit again, on an informed basis, once the terms of exit are known. In the referendum, we had to vote on the basis of contradictory predictions by the Leave and Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act, an election can only be held before May 2020 if a vote of No Confidence in the government is passed or if at least 434 MPs vote for an early election. The decision no longer rests with the Prime Minister.
The EU Article 50 process cannot, in theory, be stopped once it has begun. However, in political terms, if the UK elected a government committed to remaining in the EU, it is highly probable that the EU would find a way to secure its continued membership.

attributes.action: Defer any action to leave European Union for three year or until next Election.
attributes.background: Britain has just voted to leave European Union. The process will not start until notice under article 50 is given to EU. Britain should take its own time before giving such notice and in the meanwhile try to obtain reforms such as on immigration and benefits before starting the leave process.
attributes.additional_details: EU wants Britain to leave quickly and want to make this process as a difficult divorce. Britain does not need to rush and should take time before even tendering the notice to leave and making efforts to bring reforms. This is in EU interest as well.

attributes.action: Reform this country before deciding on enacting Article 50 to leave the EU.
attributes.background: Mass migration was seen as many to be a root cause for dissent with the EU, yet some UK firms advertise exclusively in Eastern European countries to take advantage of cheap labour. Change our laws to prevent this. Any building firm that hires migrant workers to employ the same number of apprentices
attributes.additional_details: Also, boost money into the NHS by properly claiming with the E111 system or enforcing health insurance for non-EU visitors.  In the Oct 2013 yougov report, this could save £500million annually. All UK residents must pay taxes for 12months before being eligible for benefits. This will also empower our youth to get off benefits as most migrants are much less likely to claim benefits. If UK firms must pay UK and non-UK people the same salary, there is much less incentive for mass migration

attributes.action: Work Permit For Athletes Easy Accepted Aslong As Team Provides Proof Of Contact!
attributes.background: If we do not grant athletes easy workpermits then the best football league in the world will suffer. This will mean the quality of the league will drop and tourists that come over to watch the games may find alternative leagues and teams too follow which will then effect local companies

attributes.action: Raise the salary for childcare workers in the early years sector
attributes.background: Childcare workers in the early years have one of the most important jobs in the sector as a whole. They are responsible for the early education, health and wellbeing of children under 5. A rewarding job is there ever was one however this is not reflected in their salaries.
attributes.additional_details: The average full time childcare worker in the early years sector makes less than £1050 per month after deductions. This simply is not reflective of the love, hard work, sacrifice and determination to give the future the best possible start in life. As a childcare worker there is no greater joy than helping a child succeed at being a child and being happy, healthy and confident. But job satisfaction can only take you so far when a roof over your head is needed.

attributes.action: Bring back half day closing on a Wednesday and close full day Sunday
attributes.background: We should bring back half day and Sunday closing to help the economy and give more people family time as more places are open on the Internet

attributes.action: Allow the alternative vote in the next General Election
attributes.background: With the current state of the country and the government in turmoil a General Election looks likely. We demand it incorporates the alternative vote system in order to encourage a fairer outcome for all political parties and allow voters to adequately portray their political views.

attributes.action: British people want more funding put into: science, public services & education.
attributes.background:
We all know that our public services (e.g. NHS) are under stress, that more science means more advancement and that more education means less misinformation.
So help to try and get more funding from the British government for these areas.

attributes.action: We must have a 2nd EU Referendum: Vote restricted to those aged 16 to 50 years.
attributes.background: The result of the first referendum is essentially a tie.  The result of the first referendum is made null and void by the deliberate misinformation and lies of both the Leave and Remain campaigns.  The first referendum failed to recognise that the primary stakeholders are the young and not the old.
attributes.additional_details: The political elite and the political media have entirely failed the British people. The 2nd referendum should only take place once a mechanism has been devised to moderate the arguments put forward by the Remain and Leave campaigns.  At the very least, arguments would require references which support the argument, in a similar way to academic papers being considered for publication in a journal.

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for over 25s to £10.00 hour.
attributes.background: Minimum wage for over 25s is set to increase in April next year. This is is not good/quick enough. The minimum wage for over 25 currently stands at £7.20ph.
attributes.additional_details: Minimum wage should increase for over 25s from £7.20 to £10.00, £7.20 is not a liveable wage at all, it's time for a new minimum wage to take place straight away.

attributes.action: As law all convicted racists must integrate with whom they discriminate against
attributes.background: Instead of a slap on the wrist show them the people they are discriminating against, in a community service like format make them for example: go to mosque or church and go to community gatherings for an alotted ammount of hours

attributes.action: Take actions to eliminate bullying to teenage boys that enjoy Performing Arts.
attributes.background:
I'm a young boy and I really like dance - so much, that I would like to do it as a career. But unfortunately this isn't an easy thing to do - lots of homophobic bullying is involved. This shouldn't be tolerated. Boys and girls are equal - and so should be treated as so.
FACE THE FACTS, BOYS DANCE!

attributes.action: Over 60's should not be able to vote on our generations issues!
attributes.background: Anything from the EU vote to who becomes the new leader of the country are all decisions which will affect the current and young generation most. We are the ones who'll be living and dealing with the changes allot more. People who are older don't have to worry so much, our youth are your future!
attributes.additional_details: The youth are the future of the nation however the voices of the past get heard allot more! this has to stop.

attributes.action: Create basic check to ensure voters understand what they are voting about/on
attributes.background:
One of the benefits of being a British citizen is the right to vote, and to know that your vote has the power to influence laws, policies, taxes and more. 

It should be the duty of the government to British democracy to ensure and check that voters understand what they are voting on/about.
attributes.additional_details:
One example: an increase in the Google search term "What is the EU?" within the UK, the day after these searchers potentially voted on it. 
http://www.techinsider.io/what-is-the-eu-is-top-google-search-in-uk-after-brexit-2016-6

attributes.action: To strengthen Sections 28 to 32 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 (Anti-Racism)
attributes.background:
The result of the EU referendum has lead to incidents of racist abuse.
UK immigrants, residents, and foreign nationals would benefit from reassurance and the strengthening of protection at this time. The government have an opportunity to strengthen the sentencing powers in relation to racial crime.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to a heightened period of public concern, tension, and political unrest; the tenor and rhetoric of the 'Leave campaign' in relation to immigration may result in a perception and presumption that the public airing of racist comments are an acceptable expression of views.

Evidence of some racist incidents can be found here: https://www.facebook.com/sarah.leblanc.718/media_set?set=a.10101369198638985.223406919&type=3

attributes.action: People who save for a pension shouldn't be taxed on it when they retire.
attributes.background: People who save for a pension do so and reduce their monthly spend. A pension is to help in later life when you need every penny. I had less of a life style to ensure I could look after my family in my later years. No taxing pensions when you retire would also encourage more to save.

attributes.action:
-Extend EU exit interim period to 5years.
-Final Decision Referendum in Year 5.
attributes.background: The EU referendum was too close to be conclusive, and the future of the UK too uncertain to leave the EU in 2 years. We the undersigned request that the interim exit period be extended to 5 years with a Final Decision Referendum taking place in Year 5. We do not want this http://bit.ly/28TVrjb

attributes.action: Give free British citizenship to EU immigrants working in the UK over 5 years.
attributes.background: The U.K. is demonstrating a hostile feeling towards all immigrants.And now we are a population that feel openly ostracised,voiceless,discriminated against and unwelcome. We need clear evidence that we are wanted and welcome in this country and proof that we are an integral part of the U.K.'s future.
attributes.additional_details: The leaders of this country have a lot to answer to Immigrants for now.What's in it for us now that we are out of the EU and living in the UK? Besides xenophobia and ostracisation? What certainties are there for immigrants' future as members of this society and how are we clearly a part of the strategy for a United Kingdom that no longer abides by the laws and regulations of the EU. Giving us British citizenship will be the only true way immigrants will feel included and part of the U.K. again.
attributes.creator_name: Vasco Sérgio Rodrigues Gaspar de Almeida Santos

attributes.action: Increased court powers and sentences for racially motivated attacks.
attributes.background: In the wake of the referendum, there have been massively increased reports of racially motivated attacks on foreign born nationals and Muslims. We need much tougher sentences to stop this from becoming the norm.

attributes.action: Renegotiate a better deal with the EU before a 2nd referendum
attributes.background: The Government should return to the negotiating table with the EU to attempt to secure a better deal for the UK to remain, acceptable to the British public, which could then be offered to the British people in a 2nd referendum BEFORE Article 50 of the Lisbon treaty is invoked.
attributes.additional_details: David Cameron negotiated the deal with the EU from a position of weakness, by declaring beforehand that he wanted to remain. The referendum result has resulted in a general acceptance within the EU that change is needed. Now that it is clear to Europe that we WILL leave under the present conditions, we should offer the EU a 2nd referendum IF AND ONLY IF a more acceptable deal, addressing voters key concerns over immigration, can be offered to the British Electorate.

attributes.action: Parliament must not recess until there is a  ratified plan post-referendum
attributes.background: The electorate needs leadership and understanding. Parliament must sit until this is achieved. All facts and assertions must be independently verified and it must be a contempt of Parliament to knowingly supply, support or provide inaccurate or misleading information.
attributes.additional_details: The UK is in danger of disintegration. Leadership is needed.
